sen.e: Ranryo-o, who is a handsome and great commander, challenged to a battle covering his graceful face under fierce mask, and won a great victory.

sen.j: 兵たちが喜んでその勇士を歌に歌ったのが曲の由来とされている。
sen.e: It is believed that the number originated from exulted soldiers singing about the brave warrior.

sen.j: 武人の舞らしい勇壮さの中に、絶世の美貌で知られた蘭陵王を偲ばせる優雅さを併せ持つ。
sen.e: The number is marked by both heroism worthy of warrior's dance and elegance that recollect Ranryo-o, who was known for his matchless handsomeness.

sen.j: この曲の由来となった伝説によると、高長恭はわずか五百騎で敵の大軍を破り洛陽を包囲するほどの名将であった。
sen.e: According to the legend that originated the number, Changgong GAO was a great commander who was capable of defeating a massive enemy force just by 500 horseman.

sen.e: According to the legend that originated the number, Changgong GAO was a great commander who was capable of defeating a massive enemy force just by 500 horsemen to surround Rakuyo (Luoyang, Loyang).

sen.e: According to the legend that originated the number, Changgong GAO was a great commander who was capable of defeating a massive enemy force just by 500 horsemen to surround Rakuyo (Luoyang).
sen.cmt: 洛陽の英語読みが2つあるので、一つにしました。

sen.j: しかし「音容兼美」と言われるほど美しい声と優れた美貌であったため、兵達が見惚れて士気が上がらず、敵に侮られるのを恐れ、必ず獰猛な仮面をかぶって出陣したと言うもの。
sen.e: However he wore fierce mask in every battle to avoid being looked down by the enemy for low morale of soldiers, who were charmed with his beautiful voice and handsomeness.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However having had as golden voice and good looks as it was said 'Onyo Kenbi' (both voice and looks were excellent), he wore fierce mask in every battle to avoid being looked down by the enemy for low morale of soldiers who fascinated him.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「「音容兼美」と言われるほど」を補足しました。
sen.e: However, since Changgong GAO had such a golden voice and was so handsome that people described him as 'Onyo Kenbi' (having both an excellent voice and looks), he wore a fierce mask in every battle so that the enemy would not look down on his soldiers, who might otherwise be demoralized due to their fascination with him.
sen.cmt: Have a good looksという表現はWebではほとんどヒットしなかったので変更しました。また前半と後半を変更しました。

sen.j: 男性がこの舞を舞うときは伝説に則して竜頭を模した仮面を用いるが、女性や子供が舞う場合は優しい顔立ちであった高長恭になぞらえてか化粧を施しただけの素顔で舞うこともある。
sen.e: When a male dances Ranryo-o, he wears a dragonhead shaped mask in accordance with the legend, but in some cases only wears makeup when a female or a child dance the number to imitate the graceful feature of Changgong GAO.

sen.j: この伝説の実際の所は、北周が兵を発して洛陽を包囲した時、援軍を率い城門の前に到着したものの城内の人間が敵の策謀を疑って門を開けなかった。
sen.e: The actual fact of the legend is that, Changgong GAO arrived at Rakuyo (Luoyang, Loyang) castle gate with reinforcement when Northern Zhou enveloped Rakuyo, but people inside of the castle did not open the gate suspecting of enemy machinations.

sen.j: そのため高長恭が兜を脱ぎ顔を晒した所、類まれな美貌にその正体を悟った門兵が扉を開き、無事に包囲を破って洛陽の解放に貢献した。
sen.e: Therefore Changgong GAO took off the helmet to show his face, so gate guard realized his identity from the rare countenance and opened the gate, and Changgong GAO safely broke envelopment, which contributed to liberation of Rakuyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

When Changgong GAO therefore took off his helmet to reveal his face, the gate guard recognized him by his incomparably beautiful countenance and opened the gate; this enabled Changgong GAO to safely break through the besieging enemy forces and contribute to the liberation of Rakuyo.
